org.araneaframework.uilib.list
Class ListWidget

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.core.BaseComponent
      org.araneaframework.core.BaseService
          org.araneaframework.core.BaseWidget
              org.araneaframework.core.BaseApplicationWidget
                  org.araneaframework.uilib.core.BaseUIWidget
                      org.araneaframework.uilib.list.ListWidget
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Component, Composite, Composite.CompositeComponent, Composite.CompositeService, Composite.CompositeWidget, ApplicationComponent, ApplicationService, ApplicationWidget, Service, ListContext, Viewable, Viewable.ViewableComponent, Viewable.ViewableService, Viewable.ViewableWidget, Widget
Direct Known Subclasses:
BeanListWidget, EditableListWidget
public class ListWidget
extends BaseUIWidget
implements ListContext

This class is the base widget for lists. It interacts with the user and uses the data from ListDataProviderto make a user view into the list. It uses helper classes to do ordering, filtering and sequencing (breaking the list into pages).

Note that ListWidget must be initialized before it can be configured.

Author:
Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov at araneaframework dot org), Rein Raudj√§rv
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

update

protected void update(InputData input)
               throws Exception
Reads information about selected check boxes and radio buttons, and stores this information. It is possible to make all selected check boxes (from previous pages as well) stored (see setSelectFromMultiplePages(boolean) for more information).

Overrides:
update in class BaseApplicationWidget
Throws:
Exception
Since:
1.1.3
See Also:
setSelectFromMultiplePages(boolean), getSelectedRows(), getSelectedRow()

setSelectFromMultiplePages

public void setSelectFromMultiplePages(boolean selectFromMultiplePages)
Specifies whether selected rows (check boxes) should be collected from only one page or from multiple pages. Default is from one page (false).

If the selected rows are collected from all pages then the selected objects are remembered in an instance variable. The <ui:listCheckBox/> tag renders them checked when the user returns to the previous page. It uses the equals() method to compare whether the row is among selected rows or not.

The default is to select rows only from the current page because it is memory efficient, especially when a database (backend) data provider is used.

Parameters:
selectFromMultiplePages - If true then rows can be collected from multiple pages. If false then rows can be collected from the current page.

isSelectFromMultiplePages

public boolean isSelectFromMultiplePages()
Provides whether the selected items are collected from multiple pages (returns true) or only from the current page (returns false).

It changes only the behaviour of the check boxes.

Returns:
whether the selected items are collected from multiple pages or not.
See Also:
setSelectFromMultiplePages(boolean)

getSelectedRows

public List getSelectedRows()
Collects the selected rows. The objects are not necessarily in the same order as in the list.

This method does not distinguish how rows were selected (i.e. check box vs. radio button).

Returns:
A list of row objects.
Since:
1.1.3
See Also:
setSelectFromMultiplePages(boolean)

getSelectedRow

public Object getSelectedRow()
Collects one single selected row (for example, in case of radio button list). If there is more than one select row, an exception will be thrown. In case when no rows is selected, null will be returned.

This method does not distinguish how rows were selected (i.e. check box vs. radio button).

Returns:
A single selected row object.
Since:
1.1.3
See Also:
setSelectFromMultiplePages(boolean)

resetSelectedRows

public void resetSelectedRows()
Resets the selected rows so they wouldn't appear selected on the next page load.

addEmptyField

public void addEmptyField(String id,
                          String label)
Adds a non-orderable field that is not bound to any column. The label is not mandatory. This method is convenient to use when one wants to create a check box or radio button column to allow user mark the rows.

Parameters:
id - list field Id. Is required, and must be distinguished.
label - list field label. If provided, will be used as the label of the column.
